post_content:
I'm looking to buy or trade for these in PSA 5 or 5.5 NQ with 70/30 or better centering to complete the T206 HOF subset (sans Wags and Plank):

Brown (Portrait) (I have a former PSA 5 now raw copy that I can swap with cash)
[STRIKE]Clarke (Holding Bat)[/STRIKE]
[STRIKE]Griffith (Portrait)[/STRIKE]

[STRIKE]Wheat[/STRIKE]
Young (Bare Hand Shows)

Scot Reader

Bumpity bump bump.  [STRIKE]Eight[/STRIKE] Seven more to go.

Trades or my cash for your cards only please.

Happy holidays everyone!

Good luck in your pursuit. 

Net 54 members should check out Scot's T206 Insider (t206insider.com), for his End of Year price updates, for a truer market reality.  The best T206 site going, no doubt.  PSA/SMR, if you have a pulse, take notice...
Thanks for the plug Bobby! Like many members here, I host a site on my own dime with no ads and no fees -- just a love of the set and hobby.  Have a great Christmas & New Years!

Scot,

Your trade bait list is better than most permanent collections !! Amazing stuff !!

scot's analysis of t206 is not just extremely impressive, but a must read for any t206 collector!
the best part is that, tho i have never met him, i have had numerous communications & deals with him and scot is genuinely a nice guy and a gentleman!
his passion & dedication for the subject are traits that we all benefit from. :)
check out his incredible website!
Thanks for the kind words Adam and Mark.  The feeling is mutual with regard to your impressive collections, hobby contributions and integrity.  Hope you both have wonderful holidays. Scot

I just realized here, that with Mark & Adam commenting on this thread, we have Scot's Registry Leaderboard well represented.  Good to meet you guys and put some names to the impressive collections on T206 Insider Registry.

Have a safe & happy New Year!

Bob

Annual bump.

I have been checked out for a while but I’m still looking for a few T206 HOFers via purchase or trade.

I still have the tough commons listed in the OP as trade bait.
